Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of Trump being named Time magazine's Person of the Year, as it is presented as a current event when it actually occurred in 2016.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to validate the statement that Trump is still Time magazine's Person of the Year, as it only provides a Facebook post and comments as evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Trump's presidency coming to an end means he should no longer receive honors, which may be a problematic assumption as there could be other reasons for him not being named Person of the Year again.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that Joe Biden and Kamala Harris were chosen as Time's 2020 Person of the Year, indicating that there are alternative deserving candidates.
